intro: Tetrapterys helianthemifolia, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to full sun exposure. Tetrapterys helianthemifolia is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
